comment.body: @Alex-302 Hi, Tried to reproduce the issue. Under exact same setting, except Windows 10 has been updated to 19045.3570 (I don't think this would make a difference though). NEW test result occured: Last time HEVC was able to load, but this time I tried all 3 encodings ( AV1, HEVC and AVC) none of it loaded. For you information, I disabled all other browser plugins while testing as well as OS level vpn or proxy. Also, I checked DNS shouldn't be a problem. Thesse screenshots shows that Adguard is the only loaded plugin, when it is on the console will give 403 errors, and when its off the video loads normally. Here is a part of the 403 error code: `core.122c7797.js:48 GET comment.body:
> Okay, but it's not an ad on the website, but ad embedded into video, I don't think that it should be blocked, it's user choice to download such video or not.
> 
> It's described in `https://torrentgalaxy.to/rules`:
> 
> ```
> 
> Rules regarding intrusive advertising in uploads
> 
> [...]
> 
> Ads watermarked or edited in uploaded video/audio files is allowed, BUT...
> 
> Whenever there is any such ad that can reasonably be deemed intrusive, the uploader is required to mark the upload as ADS INCLUDED.
> 
> (this is done by the ADS INCLUDED checkmark below the torrentdescription box on torrent upload/edit pages)
> 
> All uploads marked as such will have a banner on top of the torrent and a special icon in the browselist to inform the downloader.
> 
> ```

I am more in favor of advertisements disappearing from existence. Of course, not everyone is like me, I would understand if someone downloaded it knowingly, but there is a problem: this site is in English and the majority of people in Turkey do not know English, the only problem is that they will not be fully aware that this torrent is an advertisement embedded in it. IMO these ads should be blocked but it's not upto me I get it.

Okay, but it's not an ad on the website, but ad embedded into video, I don't think that it should be blocked, it's user choice to download such video or not.
It's described in `https://torrentgalaxy.to/rules`:
```
Rules regarding intrusive advertising in uploads
[...]

Whenever there is any such ad that can reasonably be deemed intrusive, the uploader is required to mark the upload as ADS INCLUDED.
(this is done by the ADS INCLUDED checkmark below the torrentdescription box on torrent upload/edit pages)
All uploads marked as such will have a banner on top of the torrent and a special icon in the browselist to inform the downloader.
```

Hi!

Is that so? When opening an article, after a while there is a redirect to the paywall page.

We usually remove such white spaces - that's true, but if ads are supposed to be there.

---

As I see, your rule should be fine.

comment.body:
@DandelionSprout Could you please take a look?
As far as I can see, there are rules for `n1info.rs` and `n1info.hr` on `Dandelion Sprout's Serbo-Croatian List`, so adding `n1info.ba` to these rules should fix it.
```adblock
n1info.ba,n1info.rs,n1info.hr##.banner-inner
n1info.ba,n1info.rs,n1info.hr##.billboard-banner
n1info.ba,n1info.com,n1info.hr,nova.rs##.banner-promotion
```

comment.body: @zloyden > Is that so? When opening an article, after a while there is a redirect to the paywall page. You have a paywall page only if you don't accept ads and the site detects your adblock. So you can read the article if you accept ads or if it doesn't detect AdGuard (AdGuard uses anti-antiadblock rules). > We usually remove such white spaces - that's true, but if ads are supposed to be there. In fact there are ads there, as you can see above :)

comment.body:
Не повторяется, приложение работает корректно. Если это еще происходит, попробуйте выполнить следующее:
- Выключить все модули кроме фильтров
- Обновить их
- Очистить данные приложения, перезапустить его
- Проверить работу самого приложения.

Таким образом проверьте также отдельно модули антитрекинга, днса.

comment.body:
Should be blocked by `tukipasti.com#%#//scriptlet("prevent-window-open")` Could you please check this rule in user rules?
Also please try to disable-enable content blockers in Safari settings and restart Safari, and check for filters update.
Do not close AdGuard window 30-60 seconds.

comment.body:
Not reproduced it on my end.
Try to clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

comment.body:
@adamsx97 

> 403 errors

Is it caused by Stealth Mode? Please check with disabled "Hide referrer" option.

And test `-mirrorali.bilivideo.com^$media,stealth` in the user rules.
